title: Girl, 2, in critical condition after shooting
content:
LANSING – A 2-year-old girl is in critical condition at a local hospital following a shooting Friday evening in Lansing that police say could have been accidental.
Lansing police said in a news release that the shooting occurred at about 8:45 p.m. in the 5600 block of South Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard, and the suspect fled the scene before police arrived.
Police said the girl was conscious and alert when police arrived and is listed in critical but stable condition at a local hospital.
Police said the family knows the suspect, and that investigators are working to contact the individual as well as investigating whether the shooting was accidental.
Anyone having information regarding the incident can contact Detective Mike Looney at 483-6869 or Crime Stoppers at 483-STOP.
